Reviews.Title: “A bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: FREDERIC S
Reviews.Content: Main advantage of this hotel is its location. It is perfectly located: less than 10 min walk from train station, 3 min walk from Warmoestraat (heart of red light district), 5 min walk from Dam Square and from tram station where you can trains to almost main attraction in the city. Hotel is situated along a very nice canal, at the border of the red light district. Neighbourhood is not really noisy even during week end. I travelled alone but booked a double room to have more space. Room was lovely. It seemed it was recently refreshed. Had a nice view on the canal. It was not really big and i think it could be a bit small for 2 people as there is not a lot of space to move around the bed and to store the suitcase. There is only one sink in the bedroom. Shower and toilets are shared. Shower looked old but clean. Toilets were very clean too. In the bedroom closet is rather small to put the clothes. There was also no dustbin. Room are not really soundproof as I could hear my neighbour snored at night as if he were in my room. WIFI is available in every room and worked well. Breakfast served from 9 am to 11 am. It is continental. It is ok. The second day I arrived in the breakfast room at 8.58 am. The guy at the reception desk was just arriving and told me in a very rude way that breakfast was served at 9 am. I said I did not mind waiting . Then he started mumbling in dutch and looked really angry. So I decided to have my breakfast outside. in the morning I rather have a quiet atmosphere to have my coffee. The day after the same guy had a kind behaviour. Really weird. Except this guy, the rest of the staff were very kind and helpful. I paid EUR 99 per night. I found this a bit expensive regarding the service offered, the room without bathroom. Single room is EUR 70. I think it is a bit expensive too. I had the opportunity to have a look inside one single: it was a bit dark as located at the back of the building, the sink was old and had some stains. The mirror above was broken. This hotel is not a bad option to stay but not the best quality for value.

Reviews.Title: “To Be Avoided at All Costs (Literally and figuratively)”
Reviews.Author: wanderingtheworld200
Reviews.Content: I had a 14 hour layover in AMS so I went into the city which I have been to before. I went to this hotel and walked in. Nobody was there. So, I then looked downstairs and the receptionist was lying on the couch sleeping. I asked a couple of times if he had rooms...no answer. Then he woke up and asked how I got in. I said the door was opened. I asked if they had rooms (on a Monday night) and he said no. Then when we were walking upstairs I asked him again knowing that the Christmas/New Year travel season was over and he said he had rooms...opened up the key holder and presto, most of the keys were hanging there meaning they were far from filled. He was the most inconsiderate, rude, nasty person I think I have ever dealt with at a hotel. The price of the hotel was taken down to 70 euro. I was then told at 10pm the hotel closes and that I would need to let myself in and out with the key. This was ok. Since I needed to be back at Schipol by 6am I asked if I could have a wake up call and he said no. Then I said I need to find a place that has wake up calls. He then said he would get me an alarm clock. Mind you, the 70 euro room rate is for a room that has a shared bathroom and shower. As many rooms in AMS are small due to the lateral configurations, I expected it to be small but this was on the verge of ridiculous. The room had a sink, a broken cheap "closet", a bed, and a small tv. The view was good as it was on the third floor overlooking a canal. The location is excellent as it is about a ten minute walk from the Amsterdam Centraal Station which has trains leaving constantly and taking 15-20 minutes each way. Would I recommend this hotel? Emphatically no.

Reviews.Title: “Great improvments”
Reviews.Author: Christopher900
Reviews.Content: aAways stay at the Anco when we go to Amsterdam and the Improvments are Fantastic and the plans for more look good as well thanks to Karl,josef,Dennis and especialy Dave for making it feel like home home wont stay anywhere ekse. Keep it up Guys. will see you all in ten weeks. Chris and NIk LOndon

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Cosy, right where we want to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ardanwenbe
Reviews.Content: We always stay here when in Amsterdam, right next to The places we go out. Nice refurbished rooms after The renovation! Calm rooms in the hotel but of you need some action, you can Find it

Reviews.Title: “greattt staff”
Reviews.Author: ric b
Reviews.Content: very accomodating staff..they were very friendly and full of life. the owners were wonderful and went out of their way to make you happy. AS for Dave - he is the perfect host..LOVE love love him..his happiness and energetic ways make me feel at home. Thanks again guys for making my vacation a wonderful one

Reviews.Title: “Canal House Ambience”
Reviews.Author: SirenaSteve
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, steep stairs, shared bath... That's Amsterdam! Anco has great canal-front location, extremely clean, great breakfast and friendly management. We loved sitting on the front stoop with a cold beer and soaking up the neighborhood. Our first choice for retrun accommodations

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at Anco”
Reviews.Author: moesvipmail
Reviews.Content: My name is mo I stayed at Anco's for 2 nights The new Management are very nice and friendly they know how to make you feel welcome the guest are also friendy meet a few friends. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff & central location!”
Reviews.Author: sxthree
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying twice during my recent holiday to Amsterdam & Belgium. Within a few hours of arriving I was on a private canal tour with a great bunch of guests & Dave is a wonderful guide. The morning breakfasts are a great start to the day & a nice way to meet others. Location is central for venturing out & easy to find your way around from. Great people, place & price. Happy to recommend & return again soon!

Reviews.Title: “er...”
Reviews.Author: Blimee
Reviews.Content: if you want to get an idea of their lousy service, just phone them and try to book a room. It'll give you a flavour of what to expect when you get there. I guess there are obvious reasons why gay men would want to go here, but that means the rude staff don't have to try. Be great if they got proper competition, hope some aspiring entrepreneur gives them some, it's needed. Should have followed my instinct. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: crafty69er
Reviews.Content: The Anco Hotel is conveniently located, clean, comfortable, and owned and managed by two very pleasant, friendly, and helpful gentlemen. The entire staff was friendly and helpful and always provided personalized service. The breakfast was delicious with a variety of choices. Our next trip to Amsterdam will definitely find us staying at the Anco!

Reviews.Title: “Small, central, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Cheocheo
Reviews.Content: Male only, super clean, can't get any more central, professional staff and service. Fabulous quality and service for a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great experience”
Reviews.Author: halffullbottle
Reviews.Content: I spent at the Anco Hotel a few days in July, and had an enjoyable time there. It was my first time in a gay hotel, but the standard of the place and the service was in average much better than other places located in the same area - The staff were very friendly and welcoming, and the room (dormitory) clean. The staff answer any questions you might have about the city and showing you where to find the "most interesting" places :). Most gay parties take place over the weekend, so I missed them, but still I met people in the hotel which were willing to have some fun during the week - specially that interesting Brazilian guy on a eurotrip Berlin-Amsterdam-Paris with whom I shared two really hot nights and I hope to keep in touch- one of them with hardly any sleep :P! 100% recommendable, either if you go on your own or with more people.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BigGameSD
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with a friend last weekend for 2 nights. Great location! Everything was very nice. I'd recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “It was friendly but you should know whats there”
Reviews.Author: gav4now
Reviews.Content: the staff was very helpful and friendly. I just stayed for one night. I'm 25 and when I walked in I noticed it was a very cruisy atmosphere, The age range was older than me but sure as long as you know how to get past any come ons. It was my first experience in a gay hotel, I stayed in the dorm, it was clean, fresh towels provided and a key to get you in late.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: shemale_lover
Reviews.Content: Thought id take the time to write a review of this hotel as i read all the other reviews on here before i went. Excellent location right in the redlight district of the city, only 5mins walk from "Bloedstraat" (shemale area of redlight district!) so ideal if thats your thing! There is a coffee shop a few doors up which i didnt actually visit as there is loads of others with 5 mins walk. There is also a handy take away (burgers chips etc.) on the corner of the street. As for noise i had a room facing the court yard so was very peacefull, cant see it being that nosiey if your facing the street its not a very busy street. As for the stairs ive heard a few others mention they are steep and a tight spiral but its really not a issue adds to the charm of the place to be honest. The staff where friendly although i didnt have much to do with them apart from checking out and in. Its no smoking but on my last night i had a couple of J's out the window and no one noticed. Ive heard a few people metion the breakfast is good...its not to be honest was just a fired egg on toast (need a couple slices of bacon or a couple of sauasages to go with it!) As for meeting other like minded guys i think i went at the wrong time of year as the hotel seemed pretty empty, i left my door open a few times in the hope of meeting someone but no one was around! About half an hour before i was due to check out in a last dicth effort to meet somone i decided to leave the shower curtain open and door to the shower open (opens on to corridoor) and someone did join me!! Upon arrival at central station i decided to get a taxi to the hotel to save getting lost/reading a map i would advise against this as it cost 20 euro and it is litlary a 15 min walk and easy to find. Overall a great location i dont think i went more than 10 mins walk away from hotel during my 3 day stay. Will defo return one day.

Reviews.Title: “basic but good”
Reviews.Author: londonlover68
Reviews.Content: The 'Anco Hotel' is a gayhotel located in the red light district of Amsterdam. The location is great for gays as a base of operation to visit clubs, bars ... It's a little less suited if you're in Amsterdam for (regular) tourism or business. My room was located at the streetside, right opposite a very busy street full of bars and brothels, so I had a lot of noise all night long. The great thing about the 'Anco' is the friendly and relaxed attitude of the managers and staff. They are extremely nice, respectful and always there to help or have a chat with. And they are upgrading their hotel all the time... just when I left my bed was going to be replaced by a new one with spring-mattress. And a lot of rooms already have a flatscreen tv. There's really nothing bad to say about the 'ANCO', you just have to accept that when you choose this hotel you're not going to have a quiet holiday.... but I don't think that those who select this hotel are very concerned about having a good night rest ;-) It's a basic hotel, the prices are very reasonable, it's located nearby the central station (I walked to the station in less than 10 minutes), you get a good breakfast (with fried egg), everything is clean and the owners are lovely guys ... Yes, I would recommend this hotel to any gay travelling to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, relaxed and immaculately clean, I'd definitely recommend!”
Reviews.Author: caedonianboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights at the beginning of July. The staff were brilliant from the second I arrived in the taxi. My cases were taken upstairs for me to my room which was totally adequate and more than I expected for the modest price I paid. The room was serviced daily while I had my breakfast which was lovely and the staff were always on hand to keep me right on where best to go to make the best of my time in Amsterdam. The room was always clean and equipped with a TV and vanity sink and although the shower facilities were shared I think this is a small compromise to make for the amazing location and obvious space issues associated with any canal house in Amsterdam. I would also like to add that the current owners (lovely guys) only took over the hotel in March and seem to have some good plans for the improvment of the rooms, although they are perfectly adequate for the price you pay to stay there at the moment. And having read previous reviews, I know they have already improved the quality of service beyond regognition. I will definitely be back! Staff are A1! Location is brilliant and the hotel has an excellent atmosphere. Well done chaps!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff. Room was just ok. Quite...”
Reviews.Author: dmhinsf
Reviews.Content: Great staff. Room was just ok. Quite noisy part of town. Location is convenient to all including central station. A nice breakfast is included.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at The Anco Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vann-mann
Reviews.Content: Third visit to Amsterdam and it was our first stay at The Anco. From beginning to end it was a wonderful experience. Everyone who works at The Anco is very friendly and helpful and it made our 4 day stay in Amsterdam very enjoyable. We stayed in the studio, room 14. Our room had a lovely view of the canal. It was spacious, modern and very clean and had a small kitchen. There was coffee and tea provided. Also included is a breakfast in the lobby which was very good. Next time we are visiting Amsterdam we would want stay at The Anco for sure.

Reviews.Title: “With the new management you would...”
Reviews.Author: Mwulli
Reviews.Content: With the new management you would expected a better service. Bar and reception completely renovated with a modern and fresh look. Service remains grumpy and unfriendly. After visiting for many years it is getting time to look for another place. Personel does not know how to treat a paying client.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pete2285
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the red light area so can be a bit noisy but has the advantage that everything is at your doorstep. The rooms are very basic but adequate - the all-day movies were a bonus! The stairs to the top floor were a killer but that is expected in Amsterdam. Breakfast was casual and filling, very pleasant. Staff were helpful but allowed you to have your privacy. If you are a light sleeper, take ear plugs or ask for a room at the back!

Reviews.Title: “Simple, inexpensive, and perfect location for exploring the city!”
Reviews.Author: RowdyCub
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for singles or couples that need a simple crashpad from which to explore all that Amsterdam has to offer. 3 of 5 points Bed: 0 points - The very soft foam mattress, along with hard wood boards underneath was very hard on my back. Single rooms provided only a small twin bed. Bathroom: 1/2 point - Bathrooms and showers are shared on each floor with 3-4 other rooms. Still, the bathrooms are spacious, immaculately clean, and there's plenty of hot water. Also, each room comes with a sink en suite. Service: 1 point - Simple but efficient. Free and consistent high speed wifi. The owner of this small hotel personally checks each person in and out. The daily breakfast (which is open until 11.30am) is delicious, and the owner will fry you an egg if you ask. I paid 65 Euro/night for a single. The owner upgraded me to a double for free because I was a return customer. Location: 1 point - 5 minute walk from Central Station. Couldn't ask for better. Environment: 1/2 point - The rooms are basic but comfortable. Hallways are narrow as are the staircases. It can be very noisy at night. Some rooms are a 3rd floor walk up. However, this 18th century Dutch is charming, and front rooms look out over a beautiful canal.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN !!”
Reviews.Author: james6969
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at this hotel, I knocked on the door and said, "hello there , I have a reservation" . My reply in an very off handed and VERY unfriendly manner was "oh really " ! I thought it was a wind up ! The room was damp and the bed linen looked unclean and smelt very damp, ESPECIALLY the pillow case which smelt disgusting, damp and i'm POSITIVE it hadnt been changed since the last guest as I could smell an unclean odour on it ! So much that I didnt want to rest my head on it and had to spray it all over with deodrant ! The next day, I thought perhaps I was just unlucky with the male staff who was on duty (re: the most "unwelcome" welcome at a hoteI I have ever had after travelling the world, but to my surprise the person on breakfast duty was SO rude, ignorant and off hand, I thought it must be a set up and that jeremy beadle was going to jump out from behind me ! It was like I was being given the "silent" treatment and made to feel like I shouldnt be there ! (B.t.w. I am the most fiendly and polite person you could wish to meet I can assure you! ) APART from this, the location was perfect for the gay scene (2 mins walk) and amsterdam and the rest off the duch people were wonderful ! WHY OH WHY can a hotel like this not know that the fundamental basics are to show even just a LITTLE bit of good manners and be a little bit sociable to its paying guests ? After all they are PAYING to stay there !! Still full of disbelief !!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, basic rooms - good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Wapping1
Reviews.Content: The Anco is a basic value gay tourist hotel. the location is excellent for the cruisy gay nighlife. The room we stayed in was small, clean and basic with shared toilet and shower, which were kept clean and we never had to wait for. The room was to the front of hte building which overlooks the canal and a charming church with regular chimes which seem to stop after about 11pm. There was some street noise from hte bars across the canal. The clientele seemed to be regular guests and were friendly enough at breakfast which was a perfectly adequate buffet affair which ran until 11.30.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Nutzwet
Reviews.Content: I wanted a single room but they were sold out. They offered me 2 nights in a dormitory type room with 4 other beds, in addition to a shared bathroom and shower etc... Although I admit I was a bit nervous about this, I decided it would be an adventure and a welcome break from the usual experience. The hotel is in a perfect location, close to everything. You can crawl from the Warmoes leather bars if needed. It was clean and very friendly. My roommates were very nice. A German, a Scot and a Brit. Although I did not see them much as we were all out on the town most of the time. There was never a wait for the bathrooms or showers and I felt comfortable. I was concerend about being able to clean up before a big night on the town, but there was no need to worry. In the morning, Bill made me a breakfast omlette at the bar. Was very nice and much more than I expected for the price. They also had free wifi and even a computer to use. The only issue I had was getting my luggage up and down the stairs early in the morning when the main corridor (bar) was closed, but I managed without waking up the entire building. But I recommend you plan ahead if you have lots of luggage or checkout at a normal hour when they are open. Bottomline. It is what you make it. If the Warmoes leather bars are your scene, you are friendly, social and you are not a prissy queen. You will find this hotel to be a great bargain and a fun experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Anco”
Reviews.Author: calzLondon
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with reasonable prices... for gay lads, leathermen and skinheads... friendly, comfortable atmosphere. Central location is great if you're heading out for the night to the nearby leather clubs. Shared facilities, plenty hot water and clean, a bit dated but does the job. Didn't try breakfast though it looked fine to start your day.

Reviews.Title: “anco is cool and gay”
Reviews.Author: danaction
Reviews.Content: great all gay male hotel perfect location for in amsterdam for short stay very very central narrow hallways and steep stairs internal windows shared showers when booking ask for front rooms if u want a noisy view of beatiful church and water cannel and u can watch the red light district action all nit all rooms not facing front are quite and face into an internal light where u can see str8 into other people rooms lots of very friendly guests stay here 4 story building, higher floors get more natural light and fresh air lower floors darker small simple clean rooms as well as private rooms there are two dorm rooms 4 beds full of gay tourists the staff can be nice, helpful and friendly but in a 'dutch' way not friendly in an american or english way stayed here three summers 2003-04-05

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: cyclops
Reviews.Content: Hmmm the ANCO, an interesting place here are some good and bad points about it: Good if you want a short walk from the central train station if you want a short walk each evening to the leather and cruise bars if you fancy lots of cruising with skin and leather guys if you smoke if you want free wireless internet access if you like porn films in your room if you like having your breakfast late (until 11.30am) if you like clean and simple rooms if you donâ€™t care about room service if you like a cheap place in central Amsterdam (was 65 Euros for a single room when I stayed) if you like exclusively gay male hotels Bad if you like friendly staff if you like helpful staff if you like hotel staff to smile if you like hotel staff to make you feel like you're welcome if you like room service/fresh bedding, towels etcâ€¦no chance! if you donâ€™t smoke and dislike smoking if you don't like being cruised and bothered all the time if you donâ€™t like a noisy hotel (only seems to be if you are in the front rooms, the back is less noisy but more cruisy through the windows). if you like a nice breakfast (itâ€™s rubbish, and the unhelpful staff are very unflexible â€œ11.31am is it no breakfast for you matey!â€� â€“ somewhat negating one of their best points which is the late accommodating breakfast) Verdict conveniently located, adequate hotel, vile staff!

Reviews.Title: “You can do better elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a local tell me not to stay at The Anco in the days before my stay there, but I proceeded to visit the hotel anyway - and I wished I had listened to the advice I had been given. The Anco is not good, the rooms are basic, and the staff could not have been less helpful or inviting. Would it kill Will on the front desk to smile or be at least a little friendly? There is also no such thing as room service, with the bed left unmade during my entire stay. If you also like guys cruising around the hotel at all hours of the night, looking for an open door and a willing fellow guest, then this place is your idea of fun. It wasn't mine and I would never return here. It is also in the midst of the red light district, which is an awful, noisy area. For this price, you can do much better in Amsterdam. Keep shopping for somewhere better. The Anco is not terrible, but I would not call it good.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Anco was recommended by friends. It is a very basic hotel and clean. There is only one room with private facilities. The staff are friendly. The guests are like anywhere else - it depends on the effort you put in. Mostly leather guys and skinheads go there so if that's what you're in Amsterdam for, great. It's also very close to the leather bars. The only problem we had was with noise. As it is in the red light area, there are prostitutes all around and these attract gangs of noisy young straight guys, some in cars with music pounding. There are also lots of drug dealers. Personally I didn't feel all that safe walking back to the hotel. In the hotel, there's a lot of movement with guys cruising each other - any room with an open door can attract attention and so be prepared for very little sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Anco Hotel is Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Amsterdam and a few days at the Anco. Really great experience. The hotel is friendly, clean, serves a good breakfast daily and has some hot guests. Will, the manager is one great guy! Recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Anco is AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from four days at the Anco Hotel. Clean, charming and exceptionally well managed by Kees and Robby. They go out of their way to make you feel welcome and make your visit as much or as little as you want it to be. I can't wait to return. Paul

HotelInfo.Name: Anco Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: O.Z.Voorburgwal 55, Amsterdam 1012 EJ, The Netherlands
